definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
lit. head broken and blood flowing/fig. badly bruised
enough blood flowing to float pestles (idiom); rivers of blood/blood bath

sentences.english: And let there be no mistake: The blood is definitely running right now on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 毋庸赘言，现在华尔街的确已经是血流成河了。

sentences.english: The Vmax and RI of HCC were higher than that in control group.
sentences.chinese: 原发性肝癌的血流呈高速高阻型。

sentences.english: Early withdrawl of mechanical ventilation led to an optimal recovery in hemodynamics.
sentences.chinese: 早期撤离呼吸机有助于术后血流动力学的恢复。

sentences.english: This paper reports a new method of tryptophan clearance technique to measure hepatic blood flow non-invasively.
sentences.chinese: 报道用色氨酸清除技术检测犬肝血流量。

sentences.english: There am a gush of blood as his wound re-opened.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤口重开时血流如注。

sentences.english: There were no changes in hemo-dynamics, so they were not repaired again.
sentences.chinese: 因不构成血流动力学的改变，未行二次修复。

sentences.english: Rosetting contributes to severe malaria by blocking the flow of blood through small blood vessels.
sentences.chinese: 通过阻挡血流通过小血管，花结对重症疟疾也有贡献。

sentences.english: The improvement in cerebral blood flow demonstrated significant correlation with the improvement in cardiorespiratory fitness.
sentences.chinese: 脑血流之改善同时与心肺适能之进步存在相关性。

sentences.english: Can a catheter-related bloodstream infection be treated?
sentences.chinese: 导管相关血流感染能够治疗吗？

sentences.english: Slowly it fluttered down to the earth, with its life-blood pouring out of it.
sentences.chinese: 他慢慢拍著翅膀往下坠落，血流不止。

sentences.english: Brain scanners measure levels of neural activity by tracking blood flow.
sentences.chinese: 大脑扫描仪通过跟踪血流量测验了神经活动的级别。

sentences.english: An audio receiver amplifies the sound of the blood moving though the vessel.
sentences.chinese: 有一个音频接收器放大血流通过血管的声音。

sentences.english: Apneic asphyxiation of 8 min yielded CA with no flow of 5 min.
sentences.chinese: 窒息8分钟产生了心脏骤停没有血流5分钟。

sentences.english: In the photo, Al-qaddafi's face is covered with blood, look trance.
sentences.chinese: 照片中，卡扎菲血流满面，神色恍惚。

sentences.english: The bloodflow in the graft was patent without abnormal peripheral circulation.
sentences.chinese: 移植物内血流通畅，周围无异常血流。

sentences.english: The bloodflow in the graft was patent without abnormal peripheral circulation.
sentences.chinese: 移植物内血流通畅，周围无异常血流。

definition: to bleed/bleeding/(fig.) to spend money in large amounts
silted up/obstructed by silt/variant of 瘀滯|瘀滞[yu1 zhi4]
hematoma/swelling of soft tissue due to internal hemorrhage
clotted blood/extravasated blood (leaking into surrounding tissue)/thrombosis
